subject: french
topic_title: Identity and Culture — Me, My Family & Friends

section_1_key_concepts.overview: This topic covers how to describe yourself, your family, and relationships in French. You'll learn key vocabulary, grammar structures, and cultural context for AQA Theme 1.

key_terms.importance: Core vocabulary for speaking and writing
Must agree in gender and number in French

learning_objectives: Describe yourself and family members in French
Form and use present and past tenses
Discuss relationships and what makes a good friend

section_2_detailed_explanations.heading: Describing Family Members
section_2_detailed_explanations.content: Key vocabulary: mon père (my father), ma mère (my mother), mon frère (my brother), ma sœur (my sister), mes grands-parents (my grandparents). To describe people: Il/Elle est + adjective. Example: Ma mère est gentille et travailleuse (My mother is kind and hardworking). Remember adjective agreements: add -e for feminine, -s for plural.
key_points: Adjectives agree with gender: gentil → gentille
Use 'Il est...' for he, 'Elle est...' for she
Family members are core vocabulary for all papers

section_2_detailed_explanations.heading: Talking About Relationships
section_2_detailed_explanations.content: Je m'entends bien avec... (I get on well with...). On se dispute parfois (We argue sometimes). Mon meilleur ami est... (My best friend is...). Un bon ami doit être fidèle, honnête et compréhensif (A good friend should be loyal, honest and understanding).
key_points: s'entendre bien/mal avec = get on well/badly with
Give opinions: à mon avis, je pense que, je crois que

section_3_worked_examples.question: Translate into French: 'I get on well with my sister because she is funny and kind.'
step_by_step: I get on well with = Je m'entends bien avec
section_3_worked_examples.answer: Je m'entends bien avec ma sœur parce qu'elle est drôle et gentille.
common_mistakes: Forgetting adjective agreement (gentil instead of gentille)
Using 'avec ma soeur car elle est' — parce que + elle = parce qu'elle

foundation.question: What does 'Je m'entends bien avec mon frère' mean?
options: I get on well with my brother
foundation.correct_answer: I get on well with my brother
foundation.explanation: s'entendre bien avec = to get on well with

foundation.question: Write a sentence describing your best friend in French
foundation.correct_answer: Mon meilleur ami est drôle et intelligent (or similar correct sentence)
foundation.explanation: Must include correct adjective agreement and structure

higher.question: Write 40 words in French about your relationship with a family member. Include two tenses.
higher.correct_answer: A paragraph using present and past/future tense with opinions and justifications
higher.explanation: For higher marks, use multiple tenses and complex opinions

command_words.meaning: Convert accurately between English and French
Foundation 90 words, Higher 150 words — quality matters more than quantity

exam_tips: Use three tenses for top marks
Always justify opinions with parce que/car
Learn set phrases for each topic
common_mistakes: Direct translation from English word order
mark_scheme_notes: Content (what you say), Quality of Language (accuracy), Range (variety of vocab and structures)
section_5_exam_guidance.time_allocation: Translation: 10 min, Writing: 25 min per question

revision_checklist: I can describe family members with correct adjective agreements
I can use present and past tenses
I can give and justify opinions in French

answers.model_answer: 'I get on well with my brother' — s'entendre bien avec means to get along well with someone
answers.examiner_tip: Learn reflexive verbs as set phrases
